description: This course introduces the key elements of marketing strategy: product development and management, pricing, promotion and distribution decisions. Case analysis and simulation exercises provide opportunities for applying concepts addressed in class. Upon completion of the course, students should be able to write a marketing plan for a profit-oriented or not-for-profit enterprise. Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-122 or permission of instructor. Offered each semester.
name: Marketing
prerequisites: Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-122 or permission of instructor. Offered each semester.
